required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Versus Late Use of Ibuprofen for Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA) Closure
clinical_study.official_title: Early vs. Late Use of Ibuprofen for Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA) Closure and Pain/Stress Reduction

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate the Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA) closure rate of early vs. late use of Ibuprofen (Ibu). The investigators believe that early use of Ibu will have a higher PDA closure rate than later use of Ibu. Early use is defined as medication given before the infant reaches 96 hrs old. Late use is defined as medication given when infant is more than 96 hrs old.

detailed_description.textblock: Infants with birth weight at <1200gm and/or <28 weeks gestation who have been diagnosed with a Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA) qualify for the study if there are no contraindications to treatment. Infants are randomized into treatment arms of <96 hrs old and >96 hrs old. Ibuprofen is given in the dosage of 10 mg/kg on initial dose, followed 24 hours later by 5 mg/kg dose and then 24 hours later another dose of 5 mg/kg. An echocardiogram will be done prior to treatment and then within 48 hours after treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of PDA Closures Related to Treatment With Ibuprofen
primary_outcome.description: Closure of the Patent Ductus in response to early or late treatment of ibuprofen was evaluated by echocardiogram. There is only one event (closure) possible per participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Catecholamines, Glucose, and Lactate Levels 1 and 6 Hours After Ibuprofen Administration

arm_group.description: Infants randomized to this group will receive their initial dose of ibuprofen prior to reaching 96 hrs old
Infants randomized to this group will receive their initial dose of ibuprofen after infant has reached 96 hrs old but before the infant reaches 10 days old.

intervention.description: Ibuprofen 10 mg/kg/dose for one dose, then repeated 24 hrs later at 5 mg/kg/dose and repeated 24 hrs later at 5 mg/kg/dose
Initial dose of ibuprofen is 10 mg/kg and then repeated every 24 hours times two with doses of 5 mg/kg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Birth weight less than 1200gm
- Less than 28 weeks gestational age
- Confirmed Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA) via echocardiogram and clinical exam
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active Bleeding
- Currently being treated for Persistent Pulmonary Hypertension (PPHN)
- Cardiac anomalies
- Chromosomal abnormalities
- Endocrine, metabolic, renal, or hepatic disorders

group.title: Early Treatment
group.description: Infants randomized to this group will receive their initial dose of ibuprofen prior to reaching 96 hrs old Ibuprofen: Ibuprofen 10 mg/kg/dose for one dose, then repeated 24 hrs later at 5 mg/kg/dose and repeated 24 hrs later at 5 mg/kg/dose

group.title: Late Treatment
group.description: Infants randomized to this group will receive their initial dose of ibuprofen after infant has reached 96 hrs old but before the infant reaches 10 days old. Ibuprofen: Initial dose of ibuprofen is 10 mg/kg and then repeated every 24 hours times two with doses of 5 mg/kg

group.title: Early Treatment
group.description: Infants randomized to this group will receive their initial dose of ibuprofen prior to reaching 96 hrs old Ibuprofen: Ibuprofen 10 mg/kg/dose for one dose, then repeated 24 hrs later at 5 mg/kg/dose and repeated 24 hrs later at 5 mg/kg/dose

group.title: Late Treatment
group.description: Infants randomized to this group will receive their initial dose of ibuprofen after infant has reached 96 hrs old but before the infant reaches 10 days old. Ibuprofen: Initial dose of ibuprofen is 10 mg/kg and then repeated every 24 hours times two with doses of 5 mg/kg

outcome.title: Number of PDA Closures Related to Treatment With Ibuprofen
outcome.description: Closure of the Patent Ductus in response to early or late treatment of ibuprofen was evaluated by echocardiogram. There is only one event (closure) possible per participant.
outcome.population: Premature infants born at 23+3 weeks to 29+4 weeks with positive patent ductus arteriosus on cardiac echogram were randomized to early or late treatment with ibuprofen. 2 babies which had been originally randomized to the late treatment arm never got ibuprofen and are not included in analysis.

outcome.title: Plasma Catecholamines, Glucose, and Lactate Levels 1 and 6 Hours After Ibuprofen Administration
outcome.population: Due to early termination of the study, labs were not analyzed.

event.description: Infant died from necrotizing enterocolitis, an abdominal infection not unexpected in the premature infant population.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
